decision_conditions: The proposed hardstand area in the front garden, by reason of its extent and removal of permeable ground cover and vegetation, would be detrimental impact on sustainable drainage, contribute to the urban heat island effect, and harm the existing amenity. As such, being contrary to London Plan Policy G5 and Local Plan Policy 5.10. | The proposed front porch and side and rear extension, by reason of its design, massing, scale, height and proximity to the site boundaries would constitute an overdominant, overbearing, and visually contrary development to the detriment of the local context and character and residential amenities of the adjoining properties. As such, being contrary to London Plan Policies D1, D4, and D6 and Local Plan Policies 7B and 7.4.
description: Two storey side and part single and part two storey rear/side extension; front porch extension; and formation of vehicular crossover including installation of a dropped kerb
